Description: Part of a glass flask in the form of a pomegranate. Uniformly cream-coloured; original colours indecipherable. Rim, neck and shoulder only, in one fragment. Stems of all six calyx-tips are tooled vertically from bottom of neck, giving a correct rendering of the natural fruit, on which there is no neck, the calyx-tips springing directly from shoulder. Core-formed and tooled, trails marvered and combed.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: BM Glass Fossing 1940, 28 (mention only). Astrom 1967, 58, 125 (=zW. 1972, 530, 597). Barag 1970, 185.
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (17)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (P. 153, No. 5)
Condition: Four calyx-tips missing. Completely devitrified with no remaining trace of glassy structure.
